data.event: The city began a project 10 years ago to clean up the rundown area and invested $250,000 in a study to map out a revitalization strategy, said City Councilman Danny Dunagan.
“The last thing we want in downtown for 20 years is a prison,” Dunagan said.
But that deal would have run for eight years, Dunagan said, then the city would have the option of shutting it down.
